definition: to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Now, years of doing this (a.k.a “deleveraging”) have restored purchasing power. Debts have been reduced or eliminated;
sentences.chinese: 如今，数年的“休养生息”重新塑造了强大的购买力。

sentences.english: 8A wolf pack is bedded down in the snow in Yellowstone national park.
sentences.chinese: 一群狼正在以黄石国家公园的雪地为床，休养生息。

sentences.english: As for rest and confinement should be the same.
sentences.chinese: 至于休养，应该和坐月子是一样的。

sentences.english: We will make continued innovation on the way to rehabilitate overloaded rivers and lakes.
sentences.chinese: 继续创新让不堪重负的江河湖海休养生息的有效途径。

sentences.english: He went to his mountain retreat for the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 他去山中的休养所过周末。

sentences.english: Now, years of doing this (a.k.a “deleveraging”) have restored purchasing power.
sentences.chinese: 如今，数年的“休养生息”重新塑造了强大的购买力。

sentences.english: It aims to rehabilitate and develop natural forests.
sentences.chinese: 主要解决天然林的休养生息和恢复发展问题。

sentences.english: The accident victim recuperated at home.
sentences.chinese: 这场意外的受害者在家中休养。

sentences.english: She is regaining her vitality after a long illness.
sentences.chinese: 久病一场后她正在休养。

sentences.english: Mongolia will invite 60 students from the quake-hit area in Qinghai to recuperate in Mongolia.
sentences.chinese: 蒙方邀请60名青海玉树地震灾区学生来蒙休养。

sentences.english: Ronaldo has suffered weight problems in the last months after spending more than one year without play due to an injury.
sentences.chinese: 罗纳尔多因伤休养了1年多后一直被体重问题困扰。

sentences.english: Mrs. Ko is still recovering in California.
sentences.chinese: 高师母仍在加州休养复原。

sentences.english: Emei mountain is a good health resort.
sentences.chinese: 峨眉山是个不错的休养胜地。

sentences.english: The luxurious palaces of the rich have been turned into rest homes and sanatoriums .
sentences.chinese: 富人们的豪华别墅已变成了休养所和疗养院。

sentences.english: She is now at Lushan sanatorium and endeavouring to pull round.
sentences.chinese: 她目前在庐山休养所，力图把身体养好。

sentences.english: They replenished themselves in a seaside sanatorium for two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他们在海滨疗养院养精蓄锐休养了两个星期。

definition: to recuperate/to convalesce/to take care of one's health after illness
to heal a wound/to recuperate (from an injury)
to get well/to heal/to recuperate/to convalesce/convalescence/to nurse
to take care of (sb's health)/to nurse
to recover completely (from illness or injury)
to take a vacation/to go on holiday
to leave hospital/to be discharged from hospital
